data.text: @rebeccachesley @jm_mcgrath Agree. Lead with hospitalizations and ICU.
@rebeccachesley @jm_mcgrath With hospitalizations and ICU numbers decreasing steadily, and with such a highly vaccinated population, the case counts matter much less.

@rebeccachesley @jm_mcgrath I appreciate this valuable information from JM because it allows us hard data for comparative purposes, from one day to the next. Based on what we heard from the MoH we can easily multiply by 10 to get approximate case numbers.

@jm_mcgrath I appreciate all the hard work you put in to sharing these numbers, but do you feel it still makes sense to lead with the number of cases when we know that the number is possibly up to 10x undercounted?

Ontario administered 19812 doses of COVID-19 vaccine by 8PM yesterday, for a total of 31773683 administered so far.

Among all eligible Ontarians (5+): 1st dose 89.74% (+0.01%), 2nd dose 85.87% (+0.04%), 3rd dose (12+ only) 54.37% (+0.07%) https://t.co/AH6o0yRvZu
